disease: Malignant neoplasm of unspecified bones and articular cartilage of unspecified limb

symptoms.name: Bone fracture
symptoms.pattern: May occur due to weakened bone structure

symptoms.name: Weakness
symptoms.pattern: May be present due to tumor growth and bone destruction

symptoms.name: General unwellness
symptoms.pattern: May be present in some cases

vital_signs.temperature: May be elevated in case of infection
vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated in case of pain or infection
vital_signs.respiratory_rate: May be elevated in case of pain or infection
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be elevated in case of pain or infection

physical_findings: Signs of bone destruction (e.g., pathological fracture)
risk_factors: Genetic disorders (Li-Fraumeni, Rothmund-Thompson syndromes, hereditary retinoblastoma)

imaging_findings.X-ray: May show lytic or blastic lesions, cortical destruction, or periosteal reaction
imaging_findings.CT scan: Provides detailed images of bone structure and can help delineate the extent of the tumor
imaging_findings.MRI: Can help assess the soft tissue involvement and differentiate between benign and malignant lesions
